Kemenhub Bantah Ada Trayek Bus ke Bandara Kertajati Tutup
04 Nov 2019, 04:13 by Herdi Alif Alhikam


Foto: Rachman Haryanto

Jakarta - Kementerian Perhubungan membantah adanya kabar penutupan trayek shuttle bus menuju Bandara Internasional Jawa Barat (BIJB) Kertajati. Sebelumnya, beredar pengusaha bus yang menutup trayeknya dari dan ke BIJB karena bandara itu sepi.Menurut Direktur Angkutan dan Multimoda Ditjen Perhubungan Darat Kemenhub Ahmad Yani justru saat ini memang belum banyak trayek bus menuju Bandara Kertajati. Hingga kini menurutnya hanya ada Damri dan Blue Bird saja yang membuka trayek."Busnya justru memang cuma Damri, memang belum ada yang lain masuk Kertajati, nggak ada yang lain. Yang ada Blue Bird memang kita tugasin dan dia juga masih operasi," ucap Yani kepada detikcom, Senin (4/11/2019).Menurut Yani karena penerbangan di BIJB masih sedikit, arus penumpangnya pun kecil. Hal ini membuat skala bisnis bagi pengusaha bus belum memungkinkan untuk masuk ke Kertajati."Yang lain belum masuk, memang karena skala bisnisnya belum cukup untuk mereka. Penerbangan masih sepi. Bukan mereka mau lari memang mereka aja belum masuk," ujar Yani."Kalau yang lain mau masuk, silakan mereka kan yang bisa lihat peluangnya," lanjutnya.Untuk itu menurutnya pemerintah menugaskan Damri untuk membuka trayek bus pertama dari dan menuju ke BIJB. Damri ditugaskan untuk mengisi trayek sampai semua penerbangan pindah ke BIJB."Kalau Cirebon kan kita kasih Damri memang penugasan selama setahun dari Pak Menteri (Perhubungan), sebelum semua penerbangan itu pindah," ucap Yani.Sebelumnya, pengusaha angkutan umum di Cirebon terpaksa menutup trayek tujuan Bandara Kertajati di Kabupaten Majalengka, Jawa Barat. Penutupan trayek tujuan BIJB itu menurut Sekretaris DPC Organda Kota Cirebon Karsono disebabkan karena sepinya penumpang."Sekarang BIJB kan sepi, senyap kembali. Sekarang memang sudah pada tutup. Ya rata-rata lah, di Cirebon itu ada sekitar 15 pengusaha angkutan yang sempat membuka shuttle arah BIJB," kata Karsono kepada detikcom, Jumat (1/1/2019).Simak Video "Lahan di Area Bandara Kertajati Terbakar"[Gambas:Video 20detik](zlf/zlf)

Ministry of Transportation Denies There's Bus Route to Kertajati Airport Closed
Nov 04 2019, 04:13 by Herdi Alif Alhikam


Photo: Rachman Haryanto

Jakarta - The Ministry of Transportation has denied reports of the closure of the shuttle bus route to West Java International Airport (BIJB) Kertajati. Previously, there were circulating bus operators who closed their routes to and from BIJB because the airport was quiet. According to the Transportation and Multimodal Director General of Land Transportation of the Ministry of Transportation, Ahmad Yani, there are currently not many bus routes to Kertajati Airport. Until now, according to him, there was only Damri and Blue Bird who opened the route. "The bus is actually only Damri, indeed no one else has entered Kertajati, there is no other. We have assigned Blue Bird, and he is still operating," said Yani to detikcom, Monday (11/04/2019). According to Yani because flights at BIJB are still small, the passenger flow is also small. This makes the business scale for bus entrepreneurs not yet possible to enter Kertajati. "The others have not entered, indeed because the business scale is not enough for them. Flights are still quiet. Not they want to run, they just haven't entered," said Yani. others want to come in, please those who can see the opportunity, "he continued. For that according to him the government assigned Damri to open the first bus route to and from BIJB. Damri was assigned to fill the route until all flights moved to BIJB. "For Cirebon, we give Damri a year-long assignment from the Minister (Transportation), before all the flights move," said Yani. Previously, public transport entrepreneurs in Cirebon were forced to close the route the destination of Kertajati Airport in Majalengka Regency, West Java. The closure of the BIJB destination route, according to DPC Secretary Organda of Cirebon, Karsono, was caused by the lack of passengers. "Now BIJB is quiet, quiet again. Now it is already closed. Yes, on average, there are around 15 transportation entrepreneurs in Cirebon who had opened the shuttle. the direction of BIJB, "Karsono told AFP on Friday (1/1/2019).
